interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/02/04 Average Rating: 3.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alex Gabassi'], 'Producers': ['Mammoth Screen LTD', 'Agatha Christie Productions LTD', 'Farah Abushwesha'], 'Starring': ['John Malkovich', 'Rupert Grint', 'Andrew Buchan']} Review Text: I was excitedly awaiting this series but, alas, was very disappointed. We have watched 2 episodes and don't know if we'll even finish the third.
If you're going to re-created Poirot after David Suchet has represented him to the pinnacle of the character, at least choose someone who can at least do the character justice. Malkovich is a very sad and not even brilliant Poirot who can't even get the accent down. I even noticed a few French words (I know Poirot is Belgian) that were not pronounced correctly.
A poor series, sadly. Review Title: Poor Poirot Representation Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

Instead, it was hokey. Just not my cup of tea. The study of a man who has been in prison for 20 yrs. and then tries to readjust to "normalcy" outside the confines of the prison, is in-depth, smart, and compelling - sorry for the use of that adjective again. smart, and compelling - sorry for the use of ... {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. Four Stars I AM Tom Shadyac (Actor, Director), Thom Hartmann (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Documentary ['Product Description', 'I AM is the story of a successful Hollywood director, Tom Shadyac (LIAR LIAR, NUTTY PROFESSOR, BRUCE ALMIGHTY), who experienced a life threatening head injury, and his ensuing journey to try and answer two very basic questions: What s wrong with our world? and What can we do about it? With a film crew of four, Tom visits some of today s great minds, including authors, poets, teachers, religious leaders, and scientists (Howard Zinn, Lynn McTaggart, Desmond Tutu, Thom Harmann, Coleman Barks) searching for the fundamental endemic problem that causes all of the other problems, while simultaneously reflecting on this own life choices of excess, greed and eventual healing. We started by asking what s wrong wit the world, and ended up discovering what s right with it. Tom Shadyac', 'Review', "'Amazing...' --Ellen DegeneresEveryone needs to see this film! --Bruce Cohen, Academy Award Winning Producer (American Beauty)Entertaining and enlightening. The I AM Documentary is a spark of light and a work of love. --Marianne Williamson, New York Times Best Seller"] {'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Thom Hartmann, Tom Shadyac', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 18 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '05-58876', 'Director': 'Tom Shadyac', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 18 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 7, 2012', 'Actors': 'Tom Shadyac, Thom Hartmann', 'Studio': 'Gaiam - Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} I really like this although you can argue some of what is presented. actual_interaction.title: Poor Poirot Representation
actual_interaction.text:
I was excitedly awaiting this series but, alas, was very disappointed. We have watched 2 episodes and don't know if we'll even finish the third.
If you're going to re-created Poirot after David Suchet has represented him to the pinnacle of the character, at least choose someone who can at least do the character justice. Malkovich is a very sad and not even brilliant Poirot who can't even get the accent down. I even noticed a few French words (I know Poirot is Belgian) that were not pronounced correctly.
A poor series, sadly.
